info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 2:42PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Garfield, southern Daniels, western Roosevelt, eastern Valley, northern McCone, northwestern Dawson and west central Richland Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 242 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nashua, or 15 miles east of Glasgow, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glasgow, Wolf Point, Poplar, Nashua, Fort Peck, Tampico, Lustre, Fort Peck Marina, Bredette, Frazer, Vida, St. Marie, Duck Creek Rec Area, Oswego, Park Grove, West Fork, Volt, Larslan and Whatley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
